sentence.Network_en: Everyone must be familiar with the old favourite among roses, Crystal Palace.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French paleis, from Latin Palatium, the name of the Palatine hill in Rome, where the house of the emperor was situated

encyclopedia.content: palace 发音 KK: [] DJ: [] n.[C] 1. 皇宫，宫殿例句 The Queen of England lives in Buckingham Palace. 英国女王住在白金汉宫。 2. 【英】锛埓笾鹘袒蛑鹘田級宅邸 3. 豪华住宅；宏伟建筑物 4. 豪华娱乐场所 5. 锛埑４笮达級宫廷显贵[the S]

entry.def: A palace is a very large impressive house, especially one which is the official home of a king, queen, or president.
When the members of a royal palace make an announcement through an official spokesperson, they can be referred to as the Palace .

example.ex: The Palace will not comment on questions about the family's private life.
example.tran: 王室不会就有关皇家私生活的问题发表任何评论。

entry.def: You can refer to any large splendid house or other building as a palace .

example.ex: They'd bought a huge barn with some land and planned to turn it into a palace.
example.tran: 他们买了一个带有一片土地的大谷仓，计划将其改建为一座豪宅。

means.word_mean: 2. the governing group of a kingdom;

sentences.sentence: "the palace issued an order binding on all subjects"

means.word_mean: 4. official residence of an exalted person (as a sovereign)

Sentence.sentence: It is furnished like one in a royal palace.

jushi.english: The Palace won't like all this gossip.
jushi.chinese: 国王不喜欢这些流言蜚语。

jushi.english: Their house is a palace compared to ours!
jushi.chinese: 他们家与我们的相比简直是座宏伟的大厦。

jushi.english: There was a palace there in the remote past.
jushi.chinese: 在很久以前那里曾有一座宫殿。
